answers.answer: Only your girlfriend's Doctor can determine whether she needs shots or some type of medication which comes in pill form.  It is my understanding that with the Type 2 Diabetes, a person would be started on pill medication.If her blood levels are not controlled (go too high) her doctor MAY increase the pills.  (That is what happened to me initially)  There are patients in my Diabetes class who have gone from pills to Pills + Insulin, or Pills plus another medication.  Mine is the second, I must inject Byetta twice a day, however this is not insulin.  Just another medication which helps to control blood sugar levels.  (also control hunger)In any case, be sure to have your girlfriend contact her Doctor, ask for an A1C test and please, please have her take a list of questions.  You do not indicate who told her she has Type 2 Diabetes so that needs to be verified.Also, if she does not know which questions to ask, there are many websites which describe Diabetes (WebMD for example) also she can just Google "Type 2 Diabetes" to see other information on line.Good Luck, let us know what happens  -  Anita

Yes, I did/do have a problem getting sleepy alot, before finding out about the Diabetes & even now.  Mine however, is because I suffer from Sleep Apnea and apparently does not have anything to do with the Diabetes.  Before I knew about this ailment I was somewhat addicted to No Doz to stay awake during the day.  If she has this problem that is another thing she can question her doctor about.  There is a test which will tell if she needs to use a breathing machine while sleeping.The HbA1C test will simply show her an average of what the blood levels have been within the 3 months prior to testing.  It is a good thing to have done and her Doctor should be able to explain it to her.  Diabetics should have this done a few times a year to see how they are doing.Anita
